There is NO grading information, NO drainage information, and NO site plan details on this sheet despite the manifest describing it as 'Site Plan Details / Grading Plan'.
observations.correction_relevance: Items 10, 11 — Corrections ask for grading information, drainage slopes, and 'For Reference Only' notation on grading.
observations.what_appears_missing: This sheet contains zero grading or drainage information. There are no spot elevations, no finish floor elevations, no drainage arrows, no slope percentages, no pad elevations, and no 'For Reference Only' notation. The entire sheet is dedicated to the demolition plan. The corrections require: (1) grading plan showing existing and proposed spot elevations, (2) drainage slope directions and percentages around the ADU perimeter, (3) flow arrows showing surface water direction, (4) a 'For Reference Only' stamp or notation if the grading is conceptual. Either this sheet needs to be reworked to include grading/drainage info, or a separate grading sheet needs to be added.

observations.current_state: Four elevation views are shown: West Elevation (upper-left), South Elevation (upper-center), North Elevation (center-left), and East Elevation (lower-left). The West Elevation shows a gable end facing the viewer with the roof peak centered, an electric heat pump on the left side, and a '2 ft (N) PATIO COVER' notation. The South Elevation shows the side/eave view of the building with the roof slope running left-to-right, windows, a door, and the roofline profile. The North Elevation shows another eave-side view with roofing material notes and attic ventilation calculations. The East Elevation shows the other gable end with a bedroom window, door, and the roof peak.
observations.correction_relevance: Item 12 — Correction says gable ends and eaves are reversed between elevation views.
observations.what_appears_missing: Comparing the elevations: The West and East elevations show gable ends (triangular roof profile). The South and North elevations show eave sides (horizontal roofline). However, the correction states these are reversed. This suggests that based on the actual building orientation on the site plan, what is labeled as the 'West Elevation' should actually show an eave side (not a gable), and vice versa. The roof ridge direction on the roof plan (upper-right) would need to be cross-referenced with the site plan orientation to confirm which faces are gable vs. eave. The labels on the elevation views may need to be swapped or the elevation drawings themselves may need to be corrected.

observations.area: Upper-right quadrant — (N) ROOF PLAN and area labeled 'ROOF PLAN FOR ADU'S'
observations.current_state: The roof plan is in the upper-right quadrant. It shows a gable roof with a ridge beam running roughly east-west. There are notations for drip edge, shadow board, and galvanized pieces. The roof plan shows the main ADU roof footprint. observations.correction_relevance: Item 13 — Correction says the roof plan should show the low roof covered landing patio as a separate element, not an extension of the main roof rafters.
observations.what_appears_missing: The roof plan does not clearly delineate a separate low-roof structure for the covered landing patio. If a covered patio exists at the entry, it should appear as a distinct lower roof element (likely a shed roof or flat roof) rather than a continuation of the main gable rafters. The roof plan needs to be revised to show: (1) the covered landing patio as a separate lower roof structure, (2) the break between the main roof and the patio roof, and (3) appropriate framing indication for the patio cover.

observations.area: Center-right area — Detail 2 (Section View labeled 'SECTION VIEW (N.T.S.) 2') and Detail 1 (Capillary Break Detail)
observations.current_state: Detail 1 is labeled 'CAPILLARY BREAK DETAIL' and shows a wall-to-foundation connection detail with capillary break material. Detail 2 is a section view (not to scale) that appears to show an exterior wall assembly with cement plaster, surface treatment notes, and a connection to the foundation. The detail shows stud framing, exterior finish, and foundation interface. It appears to be a generic wall section detail.
observations.correction_relevance: Item 14 — Correction says 'Detail 2/A3' does not match the condition at the covered landing patio location near the property line. A fire-rated assembly detail is needed.
observations.what_appears_missing: Detail 2/A3 shows a standard (non-fire-rated) wall section. Since the covered landing patio is near the property line (likely within 5 feet based on typical ADU setbacks), it requires a 1-hour fire-rated exterior wall assembly per CBC. The detail needs to show: (1) fire-rated wall assembly (e.g., 5/8 Type X gypsum board on the interior, fire-rated sheathing), (2) fire-rated eave/soffit detail if the overhang is within the setback, (3) specific callouts for fire-rating materials and assemblies. The current generic wall section does not address fire-resistance requirements for the property-line-adjacent condition.
